about.safety-description-1: {{renvm}} holds on to your assets when they are on other blockchains. {{renvm}} is new technology, and
about.safety-description-2: don't completely eliminate risks. Please don't supply assets you can't  afford to lose!
about.title: About
about.what-is-description: {{bridge}} enables the simple wrapping of digital assets on different blockchains. For example, {{bridge}} allows users to take <orange>BTC</orange> and put it on <blue>Ethereum</blue>, as an ERC-20 called <grey>renBTC</grey>.
about.work-description: Using {{renvm}}, a universal translator, it converts digital assets to the format needed by its destination chain. For example, {{renvm}} takes <orange>BTC</orange>, holds it, and then converts it to an <blue>ERC-20</blue> with a 1:1 ratio to ensure your <grey>renBTC</grey> is always backed by the same amount of <orange>BTC</orange>. Find out more
fees.contract-chain-fee-tooltip: The estimated cost to perform a transaction on the {{chainFull}} network. This fee goes to {{chainShort}} miners and is paid in {{chainNative}}.
fees.deposit-chain-miner-fee-tooltip: The fee required by {{chain}} miners, to move {{currency}}. This does not go to RenVM or the Ren team.
fees.ren-fee-tooltip: RenVM takes a {{feePercent}}% fee per {{feeKind}} transaction. This is shared evenly between all active nodes in the decentralized network.
fees.native-assets-ack-plural-tooltip: Both {{assets}} are required to complete the bridging process.
fees.native-assets-ack-singular-tooltip: {{asset}} is required to complete the bridging process.
fees.native-assets-ack-supplement-toolti: An insufficient balance might lead to a stuck transaction.
h2h.network-switching-message: to complete this process, you will need to change networks after the first transaction
h2h.network-switching-tooltip: This operation requires submitting transactions on two chains. You will be required to switch wallet or network after the first transaction.
mint.address-validity-message-2: Do not send to it after it has expired
mint.address-validity-message-3: Once you have deposited funds, you have a further 24 hours to submit the mint transaction to {{network}}
mint.gateway-address-timeout-error-popup: Temporary network issues are preventing a gateway address to be generated for you, please try refreshing.
mint.gateway-session-popup-message-1: This deposit address is only open for
mint.gateway-session-popup-message-2: , but you can send to it multiple times within this session
mint.gateway-session-popup-tx-completion: I can complete this transaction within the time
If you cannot complete this transaction within the required time, please return at a later date.
If you do not finish your transactions within this period/session/time frame, you risk losing the deposits
mint.gateway-session-popup-tx-time-messa: Each transaction to this deposit address takes about
to complete. For security reasons, you will need to wait for {{confirmations}} block confirmations before you can mint {{currency}} on {{chain}}.
mint.gateway-session-popup-tx-time-toolt: Block confirmation time depends on factors such as blockchain activity and the fee you set for your transaction
mint.initial-intro: Select an asset and destination chain, to begin or resume a mint.
mint.multiple-deposits: {{bridge}} has detected multiple deposits for this gateway address. View its progress using the navigation bar.
navigation.404-message-2: if you believe there is an issue
notifications.browser-off-tooltip: Turn off browser notifications in your browser settings.
gateway.amount-too-low-error-tooltip: Amount is smaller than minimal amount suggested for this transaction.
gateway.amount-too-big-error-tooltip: Amount is greater than asset balance.
tx.address-error-popup-message-1: This {{mode}} was created with a different account ({{expected}}) than the current account selected in your wallet ({{actual}})
tx.address-error-popup-message-2: If you do not have access to the account that generated this {{mode}}, you will not be able to access the funds deposited to it.
tx.general-error-popup-message-1: Please ensure you have this page bookmarked before refreshing. If this error persists, please
tx.submitting-error-popup-message: Return to previous screen to resubmit
tx.submitting-error-popup-message-signat: It seems that you rejected signing the transaction. When ready, you can safely return to previous screen and resubmit
ui.monitor.dialog-description: {{bridge}} consists of many distributed systems. Some of them are critical for functioning, others not. You can check each system status here.
ui.monitor.dialog-systems-critical-toolt: Most likely you will not be able to proceed if one of those systems is not operational
ui.monitor.dialog-systems-supplemental-t: Some UI errors may occur, but you should be able to proceed
wallet.action-connect-message: When prompted, connect securely via the {{wallet}} browser extension.
wallet.bsc-mm-connect-description: Please ensure that you have added the Binance Smart Chain network to Metamask as explained
wallet.ensure-network-added-message: Please ensure that you have added the {{network}} network to {{wallet}} as explained <0>here</0>
wallet.network-switch-description: RenBridge requires you to connect to the
wallet.switching-network-not-supported-m: Switch network directly in your wallet
welcome.subheader: An easy way to bridge cross-chain assets between blockchains.
welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.warning-message-2: don't completely eliminate risks. Please don’t supply assets you can’t afford to lose.
fees.label: Fees
history.please-connect-wallet: Please connect {{chain, en-handle-an}} {{chain}} compatible wallet to view transactions
mint.fees-ack-message: I acknowledge the fees and that this transaction requires {{currency}}
mint.fees-ack-tooltip: Minting an asset on {{chain}} requires you to submit a transaction. It will cost you a small amount of {{currency}}
mint.recipient-address-tooltip: The wallet that will receive the minted assets.
mint.sending-tooltip: The amount and asset you’re sending before fees are applied.
mint.solana-token-account-check-wallet-m: Please check your wallet to confirm the transaction
mint.solana-token-account-ledger-descrip: IMPORTANT: If you are using a Ledger hardware wallet, you will need to enable blind signing in your Ledger's Solana app settings (<0>instructions</0>) and then reload the page.
mint.solana-token-account-required-descr: Solana requires the creation of an account for each new token you want to interact with.
This will require you to sign a transaction and spend some SOL.
mint.solana-token-account-sol-required-m: Additionally, make sure that you have SOL for transaction fees.
mint.to-tooltip: The blockchain you’re sending the asset to.
release.from-tooltip: The blockchain you are releasing the asset from.
release.memo-ack-message: I confirm that this transaction does not require a memo
release.memo-ack-tooltip: Some transactions require an additional parameter for the transfer. An example is a transfer to an exchange (Coinbase, Binance, etc...). Currently {{bridge}} does not support it.
release.no-confirmations-message-1: No confirmations detected for transaction, you may wish to speed it up.
release.no-confirmations-message-2: As long as the transaction gets successfully confirmed on the mint chain, you will receive your {{currency}}
release.releasing-tooltip: The amount and asset you're releasing before fees are applied.
release.status-releasing-message: Processing a transaction on {{chain}} can sometimes take longer due to heavier network load (congestion), please wait patiently.
release.submit-tx-message: To receive your {{currency}}, submit a release transaction to {{chain}} via your Web3 Wallet.
release.to-tooltip: The wallet address you're receiving the assets to.
tx.expired-error-popup-message-1: Transactions expire after {{hours}} hours. Please restart the transaction if you wish to continue.
tx.issue-resolver-button-title: Click if you have issues with deposit
tx.issue-resolver-unresolved-text: If you were unable to fix your issue with the above tool,
tx.issue-resolver-viewing-deposit-descri: If you are experiencing problems, please read the guide below and use {{renexplorer}} to check the status of your transaction.
tx.issue-resolver-viewing-deposit-header: Currently you are viewing the status of transaction: {{depositHash}}.
